greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = largest divisor of n! that is coprime to n.
comment: The denominators of the coefficients in Taylor series for LambertW(x) are 1, 1, 1, 2, 3, 24, 5, 720, 315, 4480, 567, 3628800, 1925, ...,  which is this sequence prefixed by 1. (Cf. A227831.) - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 02 2013
The second Mathematica program is faster than the first for large n. - _T. D. Noe_, Sep 07 2013
reference: R. L. Graham, D. E. Knuth and O. Patashnik, Concrete Mathematics, Addison-Wesley, 2nd ed., Eq. (5.66).
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..200
mathematica: Denominator[Exp[Table[Limit[Zeta[s]*Sum[(1 - If[Mod[k, n] == 0, n, 0])/k^(s - 1), {k, 1, n}], s -> 1], {n, 1, 30}]]] (* Conjecture _Mats Granvik_, Sep 09 2013 *)
results.author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jul 19 2004, based on a suggestion from _Leroy Quet_, Jun 18 2004
